page.title: 08DINTON HALL
page.content: Dinton Hall is a Georgian stately home. It is obvious that it has been added to in more recent years i.e.Victorian times,by the way the bricks differ in colour from left to right. In the 1700s the grounds of the Hall consisted of the Hall's gardens, Dinton village and a few surrounding farms. Today the present owners (the Curry family) own a few fields and the Hall and gardens. The main building materials are red brick, slate and stone. There are 26 chimneys and 88 windows. The Hall is not open to the public, but is home of one of the largest village fetes in the country, Dinton Fete which is held once a year.
